articles.title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
articles.description:

His return is expected to boost team morale and community engagement in Boston.

articles.title: Who can collect SNAP benefits? Fact-checking misinformation about SNAP.
articles.description:
As the funding for November food stamp benefits remains in legal limbo and millions of families begin to miss deposits, misinformation around the nation’s largest nutrition assistance program is percolating from the White House and across social media.

The post Who can collect SNAP benefits? Fact-checking misinformation about SNAP. appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: November SNAP benefits are uncertain due to ongoing legal issues affecting funding.
Millions of families nationwide, including Boston residents, may miss crucial food assistance deposits.
Misinformation about SNAP eligibility is spreading, potentially confusing those in need of support.

articles.title: A car fleeing police slams into a bar in Florida, killing 4 and injuring 11
articles.description:
In recent years some states and local agencies have pushed to restrict high-speed car chases to protect both civilians and officers.

The post A car fleeing police slams into a bar in Florida, killing 4 and injuring 11 appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Car fleeing police crashed into a bar in Florida, resulting in 4 deaths and 11 injuries.
States are considering restricting high-speed chases to enhance public safety.
Boston residents may see similar discussions on police pursuit policies to prevent local tragedies.

articles.title: Trump administration demands states ‘undo’ full SNAP payouts as states warn of ‘catastrophic impact’

summary: Governor Maura Healey vows to fight Trump administration's demand to reverse full SNAP payouts.

Boston residents may face increased hunger and economic strain if SNAP funds are reduced.

articles.title: US airlines’ daily cancellations top 2,000 for first time since shutdown cuts began, with more than 7,000 delays Sunday
articles.description:
The slowdown at 40 of the nation’s busiest airports is now in its third day and beginning to cause more widespread disruptions.

The post US airlines’ daily cancellations top 2,000 for first time since shutdown cuts began, with more than 7,000 delays Sunday appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: US airlines reported over 2,000 daily cancellations for the first time since shutdown cuts began.
More than 7,000 flight delays occurred nationwide on Sunday, affecting major airports.
Boston residents may face significant travel disruptions as delays continue at local airports.
